com.mousebird.maply

Class Sticker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.Sticker

  • public class Sticker
extends java.lang.Object
    The Sticker class is used to represent a rectangular area we stick on top of the globe or map.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sticker()
      Construct with empty values.

      • setLowerLeft

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(double rot)
        Set the rotation in radians. 0 by default.

      • setCoordSys

        public void setCoordSys(CoordSystem coordSys)
        Set the coordinate system. By default this is just geographic.

      • setSampling

        public void setSampling(int sampleX,
                        int sampleY)
        Set the sampling in X and Y for the sticker.

      • setEpsilon

        public void setEpsilon(double eps,
                       int minSampleX,
                       int minSampleY,
                       int maxSampleX,
                       int maxSampleY)
        If not doing static sampling, break it down until its no farther than this from the globe. The min and max values control the sampling.
        Parameters:
        eps - Epsilon value
        minSampleX - Minimum samples in X
        minSampleY - Minimum samples in Y
        maxSampleX - Maximum samples in X
        maxSampleY - Maximum samples in Y

      • setImageFormat

        public void setImageFormat(QuadImageTileLayer.ImageFormat imageFormat)
        Set the destination image format for images passed in. The images will be converted to this format.

      • setImages

        public void setImages(java.util.ArrayList<MaplyTexture> textures)
        Images to display on the Sticker. This may include an image or a blending of multiple, depending on the shader.
